alert.note: Alert for Knox (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Knox County through 700 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Centerburg, or 10 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Gambier, Utica, Centerburg, Martinsburg and Bladensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central Ohio.
